verses.verse: At<WG1722> that time<WG2540> Herod<WG2264> the tetrarch<WG5076> heard<WG191> of the fame<WG189> of Jesus,<WG2424>

And said<WG2036> to his servants,<WG3816> This<WG3778> is John<WG2491> the Baptist;<WG910> he is risen<WG1453> from the dead;<WG3498> and therefore<WG1223> <WG5124> mighty<WG1411> works do show<WG1754> forth<WG1754> themselves in him.
For Herod<WG2264> had laid hold<WG2902> on John,<WG2491> and bound<WG1210> him, and put<WG5087> him in prison<WG5438> for Herodias'<WG2266> sake, his brother<WG80> Philip's<WG5376> wife.<WG1135>
For John<WG2491> said<WG3004> to him, It is not lawful<WG1832> for you to have<WG2192> her.
And when he would<WG2309> have put<WG615> him to death,<WG615> he feared<WG5399> the multitude,<WG3793> because<WG3754> they counted<WG2192> him as a prophet.<WG4396>
But when Herod's<WG2264> birthday<WG1077> was kept,<WG71> the daughter<WG2364> of Herodias<WG2266> danced<WG3738> before<WG3319> them, and pleased<WG700> Herod.<WG2264>
Whereupon<WG3606> he promised<WG3670> with an oath<WG3727> to give<WG1325> her whatever<WG3739> <WG1437> she would ask.<WG154>
And she, being before<WG4264> instructed<WG4264> of her mother,<WG3384> said,<WG5346> Give<WG1325> me here<WG5602> John<WG2491> Baptist's<WG910> head<WG2776> in a charger.<WG4094>
And the king<WG935> was sorry:<WG3076> nevertheless for the oath's<WG3727> sake, and them which sat<WG4873> with him at<WG4873> meat, he commanded<WG2753> it to be given<WG1325> her.
And he sent,<WG3992> and beheaded<WG607> John<WG2491> in the prison.<WG5438>
And his head<WG2776> was brought<WG5342> in a charger,<WG4094> and given<WG1325> to the damsel:<WG2877> and she brought<WG5342> it to her mother.<WG3384>
And his disciples<WG3101> came,<WG4334> and took<WG142> up the body,<WG4983> and buried<WG2290> it, and went<WG2064> and told<WG518> Jesus.<WG2424>

When Jesus<WG2424> heard<WG191> of it, he departed<WG402> there<WG1564> by ship<WG4143> into<WG1519> a desert<WG2048> place<WG5117> apart:<WG2596> <WG2398> and when the people<WG3793> had heard<WG191> thereof, they followed<WG190> him on<WG3979> foot<WG3979> out of the cities.<WG4172>

And Jesus<WG2424> went<WG1831> forth,<WG1831> and saw<WG1492> a great<WG4183> multitude,<WG3793> and was moved<WG4697> with compassion<WG4697> toward<WG1909> them, and he healed<WG2323> their sick.<WG732>

And when it was evening,<WG3798> his disciples<WG3101> came<WG4334> to him, saying,<WG3004> This<WG3588> is a desert<WG2048> place,<WG5117> and the time<WG5610> is now<WG2235> past;<WG3928> send<WG630> the multitude<WG3793> away,<WG630> that they may go<WG565> into<WG1519> the villages,<WG2968> and buy<WG59> themselves<WG1438> victuals.<WG1033>
But Jesus<WG2424> said<WG2036> to them, They need <WG2192> <WG5532> not depart;<WG565> give<WG1325> you them to eat. <WG5315>
And they say<WG3004> to him, We have<WG2192> here<WG5602> but five<WG4002> loaves,<WG740> and two<WG1417> fishes.<WG2486>
He said,<WG2036> Bring<WG5342> them here<WG5602> to me.

And he commanded<WG2753> the multitude<WG3793> to sit<WG347> down<WG347> on<WG1909> the grass,<WG5528> and took<WG2983> the five<WG4002> loaves,<WG740> and the two<WG1417> fishes,<WG2486> and looking<WG308> up to heaven,<WG3772> he blessed,<WG2127> and broke,<WG2806> and gave<WG1325> the loaves<WG740> to his disciples,<WG3101> and the disciples<WG3101> to the multitude.<WG3793>
And they did all<WG3956> eat,<WG5315> and were filled:<WG5526> and they took<WG142> up of the fragments<WG2801> that remained<WG4052> twelve<WG1427> baskets<WG2894> full.<WG4134>
And they that had eaten<WG2068> were about<WG5616> five<WG4000> thousand<WG4000> men,<WG435> beside<WG5565> women<WG1135> and children.<WG3813>

And straightway<WG2112> Jesus<WG2424> constrained<WG315> his disciples<WG3101> to get<WG1684> into<WG1519> a ship,<WG4143> and to go<WG4254> before<WG4254> him to the other<WG4008> side,<WG4008> while<WG2193> he sent<WG630> the multitudes<WG3793> away.<WG630>

And when he had sent<WG630> the multitudes<WG3793> away,<WG630> he went<WG305> up into<WG1519> a mountain<WG3735> apart<WG2596> <WG2398> to pray:<WG4336> and when the evening<WG3798> was come,<WG1096> he was there<WG1563> alone.<WG3441>
But the ship<WG4143> was now<WG2235> in the middle<WG3319> of the sea,<WG2281> tossed<WG928> with waves:<WG2949> for the wind<WG417> was contrary.<WG1727>
And in the fourth<WG5067> watch<WG5438> of the night<WG3571> Jesus<WG2424> went<WG565> to them, walking<WG4043> on<WG1909> the sea.<WG2281>

And when the disciples<WG3101> saw<WG1492> him walking<WG4043> on<WG1909> the sea,<WG2281> they were troubled,<WG5015> saying,<WG3004> It is a spirit;<WG5326> and they cried<WG2896> out for fear.<WG5401>
But straightway<WG2112> Jesus<WG2424> spoke<WG2980> to them, saying,<WG3004> Be of good cheer;<WG2293> it is I; be not afraid. <WG5399>
And Peter<WG4074> answered<WG611> him and said,<WG2036> Lord,<WG2962> if<WG1487> it be you, bid<WG2753> me come<WG2064> to you on<WG1909> the water.<WG5204>
And he said,<WG2036> Come. <WG2064> And when Peter<WG4074> was come<WG2597> down<WG2597> out of the ship,<WG4143> he walked<WG4043> on<WG1909> the water,<WG5204> to go<WG2064> to Jesus.<WG2424>
But when he saw<WG991> the wind<WG417> boisterous,<WG2478> he was afraid;<WG5399> and beginning<WG756> to sink,<WG2670> he cried,<WG2896> saying,<WG3004> Lord,<WG2962> save<WG4982> me.

And immediately<WG2112> Jesus<WG2424> stretched<WG1614> forth<WG1614> his hand,<WG5495> and caught<WG1949> him, and said<WG3004> to him, O you of little<WG3640> faith,<WG3640> why <WG1519> <WG5101> did you doubt? <WG1365>
And when they were come<WG1684> into<WG1519> the ship,<WG4143> the wind<WG417> ceased.<WG2869>
Then<WG1161> they that were in the ship<WG4143> came<WG2064> and worshipped<WG4352> him, saying,<WG3004> Of a truth<WG230> you are<WG1488> the Son<WG5207> of God.<WG2316>
And when they were gone<WG1276> over,<WG1276> they came<WG2064> into<WG1519> the land<WG1093> of Gennesaret.<WG1082>

And when the men<WG435> of that place<WG5117> had knowledge<WG1921> of him, they sent<WG649> out into<WG1519> all<WG3650> that country<WG4066> round<WG4066> about,<WG4066> and brought<WG4374> to him all<WG3956> that were diseased;<WG2560>
And sought<WG3870> him that they might only<WG3440> touch<WG680> the hem<WG2899> of his garment:<WG2440> and as many<WG3745> as touched<WG680> were made<WG1295> perfectly<WG1295> whole.<WG1295>
